result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthoni J Cirra

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Anthoni J Cirra. Defendant Anthoni J Cirra not in court, in custody. Attorney Matthew James Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Off the record discussions held. Defense counsel request case set hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Anthoni J Cirra appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller appeared by video for Anthoni J Cirra.  Attorney Matthew James Torbenson in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Galindo. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court for Anthoni J Cirra. Defendant Anthoni J Cirra in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew James Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Doctors Report Return. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed Dr. Collins report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court vacated Remand and reinstated bail. Case adjourned, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's Report Return on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 06 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.

Defendant Anthoni J Cirra in court, appear by video with attorney Nicole A. Muller, appear in person.  Defendant Anthoni J Cirra in custody. Matthew James Torbenson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Granting Access to View Discovery Materials, signed and filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery Order, filed.

Attorney Nicole A. Muller in court as a friend of the court, defendant Anthoni J Cirra not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in for a State V. Lee hearing. Defendant not produced. SPD failed to appoint counsel. The court appointed Attorney Nicole A. Muller to represent the defendant at county expense with no repay by the defendant. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Attorney Thomas Holland Reed in court, defendant Anthoni J Cirra not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Defendant has not been appointed counsel at this time.  Court will adjourn State v. Lee hearing for new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthoni J Cirra not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AEM and BDS
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthoni J Cirra in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Anthoni J Cirra in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
